intro: Manettia inflata, commonly known as the inflated manettia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble inflated balloons, hence its common name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Manettia inflata is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
